get.description: Return all Costs for a CostReport.

parameters.name: cost_report_token
parameters.description: The CostReport token.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: First date you would like to filter costs from. ISO 8601 formatted.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Last date you would like to filter costs to. ISO 8601 formatted.

parameters.name: groupings
parameters.description: Group the results by specific field(s). Defaults to provider, service, account_id. Valid groupings: account_id, billing_account_id, charge_type, cost_category, cost_subcategory, provider, region, resource_id, service, tagged, tag:<tag_value>. If providing multiple groupings, join as comma separated values: groupings=provider,service,region

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Whether to order costs by date in an ascending or descending manner.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of results to return. The maximum is 1000.

get.description: Return available Products for a Service. For example, with a Provider of AWS and a Service of EC2, Products will be a list of all EC2 Instances. By default, this endpoint returns all Products across all Services and Providers but has optional query parameters for filtering listed below.

parameters.name: provider_id
parameters.description: Query by Provider to list all Products across all Services for a Provider. e.g. aws

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Query by Service to list all Products for a specific provider service. e.g. aws-ec2

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Query by name of the Product to see a list of products which match that name. e.g. m5a.16xlarge

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of results to return. The maximum is 1000

get.description: Return an AnomalyAlert that the current API token has access to.

values.name: EXPC-1234
values.filter: (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.service = 'Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud') AND (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678'))

values.name: EXPC-9876
values.filter: (costs.provider = 'aws' AND costs.account_id IN ('1234', '5678')) OR (costs.provider = 'gcp' AND costs.service = 'Google Compute Engine')

application/json.name: New Name New Budget Who Dis

parameters.name: budget_tokens
parameters.description: The tokens of the Budget that has the alert.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: The threshold amount that must be met for the alert to fire.

parameters.name: user_tokens
parameters.description: The tokens of the users that receive the alert.

parameters.name: duration_in_days
parameters.description: The number of days from the start or end of the month to trigger the alert if the threshold is reached.  For the full month, pass an empty value.

parameters.name: period_to_track
parameters.description: The period tracked on the alert. Used with duration_in_days to determine the time window of the alert. Defaults to start_of_the_month if not passed. Possible values: start_of_the_month, end_of_the_month.

parameters.name: recipient_channels
parameters.description: The channels receiving the alerts. Requires an integration provider to be connected.

parameters.name: duration_in_days
parameters.description: The number of days from the start or end of the month to trigger the alert if the threshold is reached. For the full month, pass an empty value.

parameters.name: period_to_track
parameters.description: The period tracked on the alert. Used with duration_in_days to determine the time window of the alert. Defaults to start_of_the_month if not passed. Possible values: start_of_the_month, end_of_the_month.

parameters.name: recipient_channels
parameters.description: The channels receiving the alerts. Requires an integration provider to be connected.

saved_filter_tokens.description: The tokens for the SavedFilters assigned to the Folder.

updated_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Folder was last updated at. ISO 8601 Formatted.

widget_tokens.description: The tokens of the widgets to add to the Dashboard. Currently only supports CostReport tokens.

saved_filter_tokens.description: The tokens of the Saved Filters used in the Dashboard.

date_bin.description: Determines how to group costs in the Dashboard.

date_interval.description: Determines the date range in the Dashboard. Incompatible with 'start_date' and 'end_date' parameters.

start_date.description: The start date for the date range for costs in the Dashboard. ISO 8601 Formatted. Incompatible with 'date_interval' parameter.

end_date.description: The end date for the date range for costs in the Dashboard. ISO 8601 Formatted. Incompatible with 'date_interval' parameter.

workspace_token.description: The token of the Workspace to add the Dashboard to. Required if the API token is associated with multiple Workspaces.

widget_tokens.description: The tokens of the widgets displayed in the Dashboard. Currently only supports CostReport tokens.

saved_filter_tokens.description: The tokens of the Saved Filters used in the Dashboard.

date_bin.description: Determines how to group costs in the Dashboard.

date_interval.description: Determines the date range in the Dashboard. Guaranteed to be set to 'custom' if 'start_date' and 'end_date' are set.

end_date.description: The end date for the date range for CostReports in the Dashboard. ISO 8601 Formatted. Overwrites 'date_interval' if set.

start_date.description: The start date for the date range for costs in the Dashboard. ISO 8601 Formatted. Incompatible with 'date_interval' parameter.

end_date.description: The end date for the date range for costs in the Dashboard. ISO 8601 Formatted. Incompatible with 'date_interval' parameter.

total_cost.description: The sum of all costs for the CostReport for the requested period, rounded to 2 decimal places, alongside the ISO 4217 currency code.

accrued_at.description: The date the cost was accrued. ISO 8601 Formatted.

provider.description: The cost provider which incurred the cost.

billing_account_id.description: The cost provider's billing account id that incurred the cost.

service.description: The service which incurred the cost.

region.description: The region which incurred the cost.

resource_id.description: The resource id which incurred the cost.

tag.description:

tags.description: The tag pairs attached to the cost that was incurred.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the Budget is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this Budget.

cost_report_token.description: The token of the Report associated with the Budget.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

budget_alert_tokens.description: The tokens of the BudgetAlerts associated with the Budget.

periods.description: The budget periods associated with the Budget.

performance.description: The historical performance of the Budget.

start_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

end_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

amount.description: The amount of the Budget Period as a string to ensure precision.

date.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

actual.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

amount.description: The amount of the Budget Period as a string to ensure precision.

periods.description: The periods for the Budget. The start_at and end_at must be iso8601 formatted e.g. YYYY-MM-DD.

start_at.description: The start date of the period.

end_at.description: The end date of the period.

budget_tokens.description: The tokens for the Budgets that the Budget Alert is monitoring to trigger alerts on.

created_at.description: The date and time, in UTC, the Budget Alert was created. ISO 8601 Formatted.

workspace_token.description: The token for the Workspace the ResourceReport is a part of.

user_token.description: The token for the User who created this BudgetAlert.

user_tokens.description: The Users that receive the alert.

duration_in_days.description: The number of days from the start or end of the month to trigger the alert if the threshold is reached.

threshold.description: Alerts only send if they reach this number (as a percentage). When threshold is 100, that means alerts are triggered once costs reach 100% of the budget.

period_to_track.description: The period tracked on the alert. Used with duration_in_days to determine the time window of the alert. Possible values: start_of_the_month, end_of_the_month.

integration_provider.description: The provider used for sending alerts. This must be configured in the console. Possible values are: slack, microsoft_graph.

recipient_channels.description: The channels receiving the alerts. Requires an integration provider to be connected.
